Also what folks tend to forget is the ratio of ship mass to fuel tank mass. A 6KT ship with a single spherical tank is just not going to cut it, despite the high DV. Hence why you have some pretty large tanks. So a comparison of fuel mass to your ship's dry weight is likely in order

Anyway, RoverDude, I have 2 suggestions :

1. How about adding 3.75m octagonal drone core? Interplanetary shipping is a work of many burdens (for provisions, and for emotional inconvinience of crewkerbals, either), and it seems that unmanned interplanetary liner is very very nice idea.

2. I wish VTOL Engine have 'control from here' function. (treating the top of VTOL Engine as 'forward') As now, landing with VTOL (especially on the Autopilot mode) is tremendously hard, except when I put a docking port on the top of vessel. (to do 'control from here' at the docking port) But just putting a not-using docking port as purely for an align indicator seems quite strange. VTOL Engine itself having 'control from here' function treating the top of vessel as 'forward' seems to perfect answer of this problem.
